> If you want, a mailing list could be set up at sourceforge. It'd 
also benefit from people just finding out about Gladiator and joining 
it (I do have a link to this group from the front page, but not many 
people go to the front page). An tracker item can also be added where 
people would be able to upload maps and stuff, so the files section 
won't be lost.

One possible solution was setting up a message board to run off the 
fsgames.com website.  As long the number of messages doesn't get out 
of hand, that'll be cheap enough. (The only way the number of messages 
would get out of hand is if a new version came out, but then revenue 
would be coming in to pay for it.)

> Also on the short term, reluctantly I am considering shutting down  
public access to message archives to keep spammers from harvesting 
email addresses from our messages.

I would like to hear some more opinions before shutting off message 
archives.
